alert.note: Alert for Oakland (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 6:18PM EDT until August 03 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: .Heavy rain is impacting much of Oakland County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following county, Oakland. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Troy, Southfield, Pontiac, Novi, Milford, Holly, Oxford, Royal Oak, Birmingham, Rochester, South Lyon, Northville, Ortonville, West Bloomfield, Clarkston, Detroit Zoo, Farmington Hills, Rochester Hills and Madison Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
